column1: Bom Jesus do Itabapoana (Portuguese pronunciation: [ˈbõ(w) ʒeˈzu(j)z dw‿itɐbapuˈɐ̃nɐ]) is a municipality in the Brazilian state of Rio de Janeiro. It had a population of 35
column5: after being separated from the municipality of Itaperuna.

column1: The northern border of Bom Jesus do Itabapoana is delimited by the Itabapoana River
column2: which divides the states of Rio de Janeiro and Espírito Santo. The city is located 251 km in a straight line from the state capital Rio de Janeiro. Its neighbouring municipalities are:

column1: Campos dos Goytacazes – east and southeast
